title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
OB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted and then rebuilt. Currently, some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files. It also contains other files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
EB: When creating a new project for an existing directory structure and pointing the output folder at a bin directory, the system should display a confirmation message stating that the bin directory will be deleted and rebuilt. This message should also inform the user about the files that can be rebuilt from the .java files.
SR:
1. Open the project creation interface.
2. Select an existing directory structure.
3. Specify the output folder as a bin directory.
4. Attempt to create the project.
5. Observe the confirmation message about deleting and rebuilding the bin directory.
6. Verify that the message provides information about the files that can be rebuilt.
